reviewText: Teen Dominique is the opposite of her perfect older sister. She fails in school, is rebellious, fights with her parents, and is promiscuous. She succeeds, however, in mesmerizing her sisters boyfriend. And then theres a murder. This film goes back and forth between courtroom drama and flashbacks of action leading up to the murder. This is a fascinating movie that is engrossing from beginning to end. High drama, lots of action, and suspense. Bardot is at her best. Her acting is mostly outstanding punctuated with a few weak moments. But Bardot and the film itself are classic. If you see only one Bardot film, I would recommend this one. It is must see viewing.
I have seen the movie before I regard it as bardot's greatest performance but the problem is it's in French which I expected with Italian subtitles which I expected to be English subtles

Believed by most critics to be the best acting effort of BB's career (from that period I also liked "En cas de malheur", 1958 Love Is My Profession (En cas de malheur) (In Case of Adversity) [Reg. 2]) This Henri-Georges Clouzot picture from 1960 also stars Sami Frey ("Bande part" Band of Outsiders (Criterion Collection) [Blu-ray]; "Sweet Movie" Sweet Movie (The Criterion Collection); "Csar et Rosalie" Cesar & Rosalie). Acc. to Bardot's autobio , both stars fell in love with each other on the set. Brigitte remembers him as her "true love". Film: 7/10 Picture quality: 9/10 Aspect ratio: 1.37:1 (orig. ?) Run time PAL 50Hz: 2:02'15" Audio: F; Ital. ST: Ital. o/- black and white Chpt.: 8 Extras: - text introduction by Andrea Violi Studio: A & R PRODUCTIONS AND DISTRIBUTION SNC
